Senior / Staff Data Engineer. . Tech ScaleUp. . . . . My client is a Tech Scale-Up company with just over 100 employees and Series B funding. Data is at the core of what they do and they are looking to hire a Senior / Staff Data Engineer who would like to join their high performing team. The company values using open source tools , flexible working and a distributed workforce to help them solve complex problems in the financial world. The team is still at an early stage, meaning you’ll have the opportunity to influence our foundation and attack problems from first principles.. . . . . The Data Engineering team is responsible for the ingestion, transformation, and productionization of dozens (and growing!) disparate datasets. . . . . . Responsibilities:. . Extract and process raw data at scale (including writing scripts, calling APIs, writing SQL/Spark, etc.). Process unstructured data into a form suitable for analysis using Scala and Python. Work closely with product owners and data analysts to gather and understand requirements. Interface with Data Platform engineers and give valuable feedback that guides tooling. Participate in code reviews and design discussions, give and receive constructive feedback. Create, extend and own data pipelines that power the company’s products. Ensure high Data Quality and pipeline stability. . . . . Requirements:. . Experience processing large amounts of structured and semi-structured data. Programming experience in Scala, Python, SQL and Bash. Minimum of 4+ years writing and maintaining ETL at a terabyte level scale using Scala and Python. 3+ years experience working with Hadoop / Spark applications . Experience with version control systems (Git). Experience automating Data Quality checks. Proven experience writing ETL and building Data Pipelines. . Experience with AWS / GCP / Redshift /Snowflake etc. . . . . Bonus - GCP experience as they are moving to GCP for the future. . . An awesome work life balance and flexible working options is a big part of this company while also offering an above market salary. . . . . . If you are interested in learning more please contact me at anthonyh@alldus.com. . Show more

Senior Data Scientist. . Tech Scale Up. . . . . About. . My client is a Tech Scale-Up company with just over 100 employees and Series B funding. Data is at the core of what they do and they are looking to hire a Senior Data Scientist who would like to join their small but mighty team. The company values using open source tools , flexible working and a distributed workforce to help them solve complex problems in the data world. The team is still at an early stage, meaning you’ll have the opportunity to influence key data science decisions and attack problems from first principles , seeing the impact of your solutions.. . . . . Responsibilities . . Working first-hand with alternative data sources to solve complex problems around classification and discovery in a complex data environment ( Time series , Text data , Healthcare data ). Working with others to propose machine learning solutions to solve business problems that you encounter, starting with decomposing the problem and carrying out literature reviews. Training and improving models for classification, clustering and anomaly detection. Working collaboratively with engineers on the team to bring models to production.. . . . . Requirements. . PhD or MSc in machine learning, NLP, data mining, statistics, or similar quantitative field. 3-5 years practical experience, with exposure to delivering production-grade systems. Strong theoretical knowledge of state-of-the-art machine learning methods in at least one domain (e.g. Bayesian Inference, Classification , NLP, anomaly detection, time series, information retrieval). Experience in designing, implementing, and evaluating machine learning experiments. Skills with Software engineering and data mining using tools like Spark . Experience with Statistics and ML libraries, ideally with deep learning frameworks (e.g. TensorFlow, PyTorch, Keras). . . . . *My client offers an awesome work culture with work life balance and flexible working solutions along with a salary that is above market. . . . . . Please note: Remote working is available for people living in Germany , UK , Portugal , France ,Denmark and Ireland. . For more information please contact me at anthonyh@alldus.com. . Show more

The Coca-Cola Company’s Technology organization is in the midst of a digital transformation that allows our employees to use world class technology to connect our products to our customers all over the world. This journey is a very exciting time for Coca-Cola and our employees are big contributors to our Success and Growth. Our large scale and complex environment offers an incredible opportunity to address challenges, enable innovative solutions to make a difference for our customers, leveraging world class technology.. . To continue this digitalization, we are looking for a Lead Data Engineer to join our dynamic team in Dublin, Ireland to help build scalable, cutting edge technologies for today and tomorrow. This position is part of a global network with a focus around Europe, Middle East, Africa and Eurasia (EMEA) that uses deep technical skills to create and improve Data Analytics solutions that help the Coca-Cola Company grow and be more productive If you are up for challenges, eager to learn and highly motivated, we’d love to speak with you!. . What You’ll Do For Us. . Work with Product Owners and Business Analysts to understand business data and related processes.. Use Agile and Dev/Ops methods, build BI applications using a variety of data sources (on-premise such as SQL Server, cloud IaaS/ PaaS, mostly Azure, sometimes Google Big Query/AWS).. The development required will include data ingestion and transformation using a combination of Azure Data Factory, Python/PySpark for ETL/ELT in DataBricks, Azure Logic Apps, Azure SQL and data presentation with cube (Azure Analysis Services) build up (SQL / DAX), all hosted in Azure PaaS cloud environment. Occasional Power BI development. Implement rules & automate data cleansing, mapping, transformation, logging, and exception handling.. Design, build, and deploy databases and data stores. Design, build and deploy data presentation layers (cubes). Participate in cross-functional teams to promote technology strategies, analyze, and test products, perform proofs-of-concept, and pilot new technologies and/or methods.. Establish and document standards, guidelines, and best practices for teams utilizing the solutions.. Review vendor-built solution designs to ensure technology appropriateness, standards compliance, and platform capacity alignment. Lead a team of data engineers. . . Qualifications And Requirements. . 4+ years of experience in development of Data & Analytics solutions. Bachelor’s degree in Computer Science, Information Systems Management, Data Science, or related technical field, or equivalent practical experience. Good knowledge of Azure Cloud BI stack (Azure certifications is a plus). Proven skills in SQL, Python and/or Pyspark for data ETL/ELT, DAX. Additional skills in one or more: Hadoop (NoSQL), Kafka / MS IoT Hub for streaming, Data Science python libraries (SciKit, NumPy, ML and Auto-ML). Proven desire and ability to learn on-the-job. Hand’s on experience with data visualization tools, preference for PowerBI. Good written and verbal communication skills. Ability to work with geographically diverse teams via collaborative technologies.. . . What We Can Do For You. . Opportunities to work with teams across EMEA and around the world. Experience working with a variety of world-class technologies. Coaching, mentoring, and career development. . . Our Purpose And Growth Culture. . We are taking deliberate action to nurture an inclusive culture that is grounded in our company purpose, to refresh the world and make a difference. We act with a growth mindset, take an expansive approach to what’s possible and believe in continuous learning to improve our business and ourselves. We focus on four key behaviors - curious, empowered, inclusive and agile - and value how we work as much as what we achieve. We believe that our culture is one of the reasons our company continues to thrive after 130+ years. Visit Our Purpose and Vision to learn more about these behaviors and how you can bring them to life in your next role at Coca-Cola.. . We are an Equal Opportunity Employer and do not discriminate against any employee or applicant for employment because of race, color, sex, age, national origin, religion, sexual orientation, gender identity and/or expression, status as a veteran, and basis of disability or any other federal, state or local protected class. When we collect your personal information as part of a job application or offer of employment, we do so in accordance with industry standards and best practices and in compliance with applicable privacy laws.. . Description Of Business Unit. . Reporting to the Chief Data & Analytics Officer (CDAO), the Strategic Analytics team is responsible for the development and execution of the Bank's data analytics strategy. The role holder will deliver value-prioritised analytics projects that are closely aligned to the Groups strategic ambition in a scrum team on behalf of internal customers; and contribute to identifying appropriate framework tools and standards to enable Bank of Ireland to become a data driven organisation at all levels of the company.. . Purpose of the Role. . This is a Group role to lead technical solution delivery for strategic analytics projects, realising the value of our Enterprise Data. You will design, develop and deliver solutions to businesses across the Group, using cutting edge technologies in data exploration, machine learning and visualisation.. . You will have an opportunity to partner with the business on a wide range of projects, collaborating on appropriate ways of working and proposing new methodologies.. . In a Chief Data & Analytics Office management position, you will contribute more broadly to the achievement of overall strategies, plans and priorities.. . Key Accountabilities. . Build high quality data visualisations and predictive models autonomously to provide insight into business process and strategy for Senior Leaders.. Engage stakeholders, and challenge requirements, to respond to critical business issues, and support the organisation's strategy and values. Use advanced analytics to provide insight into the customer base, developing independent key metrics such as customer activity, product penetration, share of wallet and transactional behaviour preferences.. Conducts data science related engineering to create new data marts and productionised data features, to embed and scale machine learning and other analytics models. Collaborate with colleagues from across the Bank to eliminate silos, to drive the adoption of the Enterprise Data Warehouse & Enterprise Data Lake and to share best practice. Engage Senior Business network across Retail, Corporate & Marketing to generate demand, discover issues and innovate solutions. Contribute to a creative data driven culture centred on an agile environment, problem solving and design thinking, contributing data science expertise to new sales activities. Promote awareness of analytics, emerging industry trends (inc. regulation) and a digital future. Support the Community of Practice, Inclusion & Diversity, and our shared Group values and purpose. . . . What Is The Opportunity. . In Advanced Analytics, you will work as part of a dynamic and ambitious team, and be a driving force behind digital transformation in Bank of Ireland. You will gain significant exposure to developing data science solutions end to end, leveraging applied statistics and supervised/unsupervised machine learning methodologies, on both structured and unstructured datasets, to extract value from numerous, disparate, complex data sources.. . You will also gain exposure to solution architecture, user experience design, strategy development/execution and project management. This is a high visibility role and a great opportunity for you to make a difference to our colleagues, customers and stakeholders, through leveraging data as an asset.. . Essential Qualifications. . Third Level qualification, in mathematics, statistics, finance, IT, or another discipline including a significant numerical element. . Essential Skills & Experience. . 5+ years of experience in data science, including statistical model development such as logistic regression, neural networks or machine learning. Strong proficiency in database technologies eg. SQL, ETL, No-SQL, DW, and Big Data technologies. Practical data science experience with any of Python, R, Scala, PySpark or other relevant coding language and data science technologies. The ability to challenge the status quo and support reengineering of process and use of data for business benefit. Good communication, presentation and business partner skills to work effectively with wider CDAO, finance, front-line business, marketing and risk teams. Strong interpretative and analytical skills, with the confidence to provide a professional, objective and independent viewpoint. Experience of delivery to challenging targets with a proven ability to handle competing deadlines. High energy, bias for action, drive for results, strong resilience and focus on execution excellence. Ability to successfully build relationships with clients and stakeholders. . . . Desirable Qualifications, Skills & Experience. . Experience in Financial Services Data Analytics & Senior Stakeholder Management.. Previous experience with Teradata, Tableau and Cloudera platforms. Strong SQL & data integration background, accessing data from disparate systems, as well as cleansing and enriching existing data through the use of techniques such as fuzzy matching and sources like APIs.. Knowledge of machine learning modelling techniques and how to fine-tune those models eg. Random Forest, XGBoost, Neural Networks, Transformers, Markov chains, etc. Understanding of process flow, data management, GDPR and data lineage concepts. . . Working at Bank of Ireland doesn't have to mean working in an office to have an impact. Our commitment to enabling colleagues to thrive means that depending on role type you can have choice and flexibility in where you work and live, subject to your role, customer needs and our requirements. We have a hybrid working model, with home, agile hub and office based options available. We will always list a primary location which can be where you go for in person collaboration, and a location where you can best perform your role.. . Please note you must live in the jurisdiction for the business to which you are contracted.. . This job can be done anywhere in the Republic of Ireland with the primary office location as Dublin to which travel will be required for in person collaboration. Exact frequency to be agreed with manager.. . Key Competencies. . Agile - Self. Accountable - Self. Amplify Capability - Self. Champion Transformation - Self. One Group, one team - Self. . . . Where Agency assistance is required Bank of Ireland Recruitment Team will engage directly with suppliers. Unsolicited CVs / profiles supplied to Bank of Ireland by Recruitment Agencies will not be accepted for this role.. . Bank of Ireland Group is an equal opportunities employer and is committed to fostering an inclusive workplace which values and benefits from the diversity of our workforce.. . About Distilled. . Distilled SCH combines Irish owned Distilled Media Group and Adevinta from Barcelona. Description. . Amazon's Customer Service (CS) department is seeking an experienced EU Sr User Researcher to join the team on a FTC for 12 months. The successful candidate will be a key member of the EU CS Data, Insights and Design team. Our mission is to amplify customer feedback and empower the business to continuously improve the customer experience. As the EU Sr User Researcher, you will be responsible for defining and executing on a comprehensive user research roadmap spanning a broad set of experiences and involving multiple types of concurrent user research. Research activities will span from generative work (field work, development of customer models and persona building), evaluative work (usability studies and concept evaluation), to summative research (interfacing with market research to parse through and translate market segmentation data). From a customer perspective, your goal is to highlight and solve Amazon practices that drive unintended consequences or undesirable responses from customers to improve customer satisfaction rates across multiple journeys and customer personas. From a CS perspective, your goal is to bridge the gap between the needs of the business and how our CS associates interact with customers in order to drive quicker and lasting adoption of policies and processes for an improved customer and CS associate experience.. . We are looking for an individual contributor who will be responsible for employing best-practice methodologies in order to obtain timely user/system insights. Your insights will inform decision-making and you will regularly interact with our business partners, project/program management and CS leadership to identify relevant research questions, design and implement insightful research studies. You will disseminate and inspire action from the results, ultimately shaping the EU CS experience on behalf of our customers and associates.. . Key Responsibilities. . Responsibility for the EU Sr User Researcher which includes but is not limited to:. . Defining the direction and roadmap for the program whilst gaining consensus and clear alignment across Amazon business and CS functions. Leading large and high impacting projects across Amazon EU CS across multiple or overlapping areas. Owning the end-to-end research process, implementing and documenting new and improved research approaches, methods and processes. Performing data analysis to determine key findings and recommendations. Conceiving creative ideas that are outside-the- box and deliver top-quality, innovative, cohesive deliverables that are customer-focused, simple and intuitive. Identifying the best method or mix of methods to address research questions, with consideration for timeline and resources. Regularly looking outward to identify opportunities for improvement and to incorporate advancements in user research methods and tools. . The Ideal Candidate Will Have. . End-to-end experience with all aspects of the user research lifecycle (study design, recruiting, moderation, analysis, reporting, communicating, budgeting research). Hands-on experience with: lab-based user testing, remote testing, concept evaluation, field research, and survey design. Experience in best practices for user research and knowledge of what approaches work and which don’t. The ability to communicate complex concepts clearly and persuasively across different audiences and varying levels of the organization. The ability to manage ambiguity, work autonomously and multi-task in an agile environment. A clear passion for making a positive impact on customers’ lives through your work. . . Basic Qualifications. . BASIC QUALIFICATIONS. . BA/BS in psychology, sociology, anthropology, human computer interaction or related discipline. Proven success conducting user research, hands-on experience in survey design is a must-have. A strong portfolio demonstrating past work experience and deliverables with a focus on quantitative methodologies. Extensive experience operating as an individual contributor in a user research role.. Experience in customer profiling/creation of personas whilst considering psychological/emotional aspect of experience and processes. . . Preferred Qualifications. . PREFERRED QUALIFICATIONS. . BA/BS in psychology, sociology, anthropology, human computer interaction or related discipline. Demonstrated ability to effectively interact with users of all ages and diverse backgrounds. UX Research experience in EU markets. Experience in conducting user research for Customer Services. Experience in emotional analysis and design. . . Company - Amazon Ireland Sup Svcs Ltd. Authentication is the way that a customer proves their identity before making a purchase. It plays a key role in the fundamental optimization problem at Stripe: how do we help businesses maximize the amount of good transactions, while minimizing the amount of fraud?. Europe is at the forefront of authentication due to regulatory frameworks like Strong Customer Authentication (SCA), and Stripe’s global authentication effort will be centered in EMEA. We’re looking for a senior data/applied scientist who will build the systems to help our users navigate SCA, and optimize their decision-making around authentication more generally.. . Data science in EMEA is ramping up, and you should be excited to wear many hats.. . You Will. . Research, build, and productize ML models to maximize conversion and reduce fraud for our users. Collaborate with product and engineering to turn your work into user-facing products. Build data sets and dashboards that help internal and external users understand payments performance and the impact of your work. Design and implement experiments to test hypotheses and refine our understanding of the authentication ecosystem. Influence the product roadmap through rigorous analysis and a scientific mindset. . . . We’re Looking For Someone Who Has. . 5+ years experience working with and analyzing large data sets to solve problems. A PhD or MS in a quantitative field (e.g., Economics, Statistics, Engineering, Natural Sciences, Operations Research, Computer Science, or Mathematics). Expert knowledge of a scientific computing language (such as R or Python) and SQL. Strong knowledge of statistics, machine learning and optimization. Familiarity with or a desire to learn a production coding language (Ruby, Scala, or Java). Demonstrated track record of identifying, scoping and leading complex data science projects with cross-functional partners and high business impact. Ability to communicate complex quantitative analysis in a clear, precise, and actionable manner. . . Please find our EU applicant personal information notice here. Show more

NXTGENWOOD research consortium funded via the Irish Department of Agriculture, Food, and the Marine [DAFM] will research and develop next generation wood-based advanced materials, bioprocess and products. The consortium is targeting applications in coatings/agriculture/healthcare and energy to realise high value products from Irish forests. High quality candidates, ideally with international forestry research experience are sought for a range of positions.. . . . . Researchers from NUIG, TCD, UCC, UCD, and UL will work closely with wood producers, processors and end users. All positions will offer 1 year contracts subject to extension based on performance. Salary approx. level 2.2 on the Irish University Association salary scale.. . . . . To apply send a 2-page CV, with a 1-page cover letter to colm.faulkner@tcd.ie by March 31st outlining your prefered post, and your suitability. Use the reference DAFM - 2019PROG704 in the e-mail subject/header, and specify which role you wish to apply for.. . . . . National University of Ireland Galway [Biological Properties of Wood Products]. . The Advanced Glycoscience Research Cluster (AGRC) at National University of Ireland Galway is seeking to recruit a full time three-year fixed term postdoctoral researcher for a four-year program. Working as an integral member of the Prof. Lokesh Joshi AGRC and the NXTGENWOOD consortium, the successful candidates will investigate the biological properties of wood products as potential prebiotics for human and ruminant health. The project will focus on depolymerisation, fractionation and characterisation of wood products, and will assess their biological properties using bacterial and mammalian in vitro models.. . . . . Trinity College Dublin [Advanced Wood Materials & Processing]. . Climate change and protection of the environment are two of the greatest global challenges of the 21st century. This research position will be based in the TCD School of Chemistry [Prof. MA Morris] and AMBER, and will involve close collaboration with other TCD research groups, and other academic/industry collaborators. The candidate will develop resins, coatings, and adhesives for wood products, with a view to enhanced durability and environmental resistance, and regulatory compliance. New composites may be developed via extrusion/moulding. Non-traditional applications of wood related products will be addressed. We seek an experienced researcher with wood science experience. International experience is preferred.. . . . . University College Cork [ Electrochemistry: Energy Conversion Membranes converting waste heat to energy]. . Generating electrical energy from low-grade waste heat is a key enabler to reduce greenhouse gas emissions. Sources of low-grade heat (<100°C) are ubiquitous and include power generation (burning of fossil fuels), industrial processes (oil refining), electronics (data centres) and biological processes (metabolism). Significantly, 70% of all energy generated daily is lost as waste heat. This Postdoctoral project will involve the development of a wood-based nanofluidic platform technology, based on ion transport in nanochannels, to convert low grade waste heat into electricity. The position will be based in the School of Chemistry and the Tyndall National Institute at University College Cork, but the successful candidate will be expected to work with teams of scientists based in other Irish research institutes.. . . . . University College Dublin [Bioprocessing & High Value Chemicals from Wood]. . Forests are integral to a sustainable, circular European bio-economy of the 21st century. This experienced post-doctoral researcher will work on the pre-treatment, separation, and bioprocessing of wood, and wood related waste streams, to develop high value, sustainable, bioprocesses. The candidate will convert wood lignin into lactic acid and lignin contaminated lignocellulose sugar mixtures to high protein yeast biomass. This work will be under the aegis of Prof. K. O’Connor, in conjunction with the BiOrbic centre, and academic/industry collaborators. The applicant will be qualified in Biotechnology, Microbiology or a related discipline.. . . . . University of Limerick [Wood based thermoelectrics]. . We aim to explore the application wood-based materials in thermal energy harvesting devices. This work addresses collaborative membrane production, functionalisation, and energy applications. Lignin/cellulose membranes will be developed from wood waste streams, with a view to addressing energy applications. The work will be supervised by Dr. M. Collins [UL] https://www.ul.ie/hri/person/hri-member/dr-maurice-collins, and will be performed in close collaboration with the Prof. JD Holmes group, UCC. The work is interdisciplinary in nature. Experience in Bioengineering, Materials, Chemistry, Nanomaterials, or Wood Science preferred.. . Show more

Offer Description. . 1 Year, Fixed-term, Whole-time Post. . Position Summary. . Applications are invited for a postdoctoral research position investigating the taphonomy of melanin. The position is funded by the European Research Council and forms part of a series of new hires in palaeontology at UCC.. . The project. . The successful candidate will undertake analysis of extant and fossil amphibians, mammals, birds and reptiles plus taphonomic experiments using in-house facilities for laboratory decay and high pressure-high temperature maturation. Key analytical techniques include synchrotron-XRF, FTIR, Raman spectroscopy, AHPO-LCMS, NMR, S-XANES. In addition to research, the successful candidate will have opportunities to undertake postdoctoral training in transferable skills and to participate in fieldwork. There may be opportunities to gain Mentorship or Teaching/Supervision experience under the supervision of the PI.. . The successful candidate will work closely with the PI and other members of the team, especially a PhD student also working on the taphonomy of melanin.. . The School of Biological, Earth and Environmental Sciences (BEES). . The School of BEES at University College Cork (UCC) is one of the most successful Schools in UCC in terms of grant capture and PhD completion, and has the distinction of having four ERC-funded projects in the last five years. It is located in three interconnected buildings on extensive grounds and comprises 30 academic staff, 20 postdoctoral researchers and >100 postgraduate students supported by 14 administrative and technical staff. The successful candidate will benefit from excellent laboratory facilities, including a dedicated palaeontology laboratory with high-spec facilities for experimental decay and maturation, melanin extraction, and tissue preparation for electron microscopy. The School’s new Mary Ward microbeam laboratory houses a new JEOL IT-100 VP SEM with sputter coater, a Perkin-Elmer Frontier uATR coupled to a Spotlight micro-FTIR, a Renishaw Raman microscope, extensive light microscopy facilities, and an ultramicrotome. Planned analytical facilities include a major new investment in a hyphenated TGA-FTIR-GC-MS facility for chemical analyses of maturation experiments in real time. Additional laboratory facilities include a furnace, dedicated histology lab, and photography facilities. Researchers in the palaeobiology group have access to additional analytical facilities elsewhere in the university, including cryotomy and immunofluorescence imaging.. . The successful candidate will join us at a very exciting time, as part of a major expansion of the palaeontology group at UCC. This includes new PhD and post-doctoral researchers, research support officer, outreach officer, and a new lecturer in palaeontology. The successful candidate will benefit from the PI’s commitment in his/her career development and her extensive global network of collaborators.. . Position start date: between 1/9/2021 and 1/1/2022 (negotiable).. . Project Title: Palaeochem: Biomolecular innovation and the evolution of animals – insights from taphonomy and the fossil record. Subproject: The taphonomy of melanin. . Post Duration: 1 year, with potential two-year extension. . Salary: €38,630 - €45,942 p.a. (IUA Salary Scale). . For an information package including further details of the post see . Job ID: 044551.. . Informal enquiries can be made in confidence to Professor Maria McNamara, Professor of Palaeontology, School of Biological, Earth and Environmental Sciences, , Email: click apply .. Show more

Offer Description. . 18 months, Fixed-term, Whole-time Post. . Position Summary. . The Research Institute: APC Microbiome Ireland was formed in 2003 with funding from Science Foundation Ireland and in conjunction with key industry partners. It represents a seamless collaboration between UCC, Teagasc, Moorepark and CIT. It is widely recognised that our microbiome (community of bacteria/viruses and fungi that live in and on our bodies) plays an important role in human health and has become one of the most dynamic, complex and exciting areas of research in both food and pharmaceutical arenas. Over the last decade the APC has established itself as one of the leading global centres in gut microbiota research. The APC has made several landmark discoveries and has published over 2,500 research articles in peer-reviewed journals, generating many journal covers and associated editorials. The APC comprises over 300 individuals, from the scientific PI’s (the APC Faculty) funded by the partner Institutions, the management team, and a dedicated group of research scientists, research assistants and postgraduate’s students. . The Role. . BacTrans is an industry-partnered project that aims to identify and exploit natural DNA transfer systems including, but not limited to, conjugation and phage-mediated transduction. The objective of this study is to develop novel and technologically robust strains of Lactococcus lactis and Streptococcus thermophilus , particularly with respect to phage-resistance, for commercial use as so-called starter cultures in the dairy and fermented (functional) food industries. The project will involve bioinformatic analysis of bacterial genomes for the presence of potentially active phage-resistance and DNA transfer systems followed by functional characterisation of the identified systems. Furthermore, it is intended to assess the technological appropriateness of the developed strains in small scale trials. The project combines functional genomics and molecular biological approaches to defining the mechanism of action of DNA transfer and/or phage-resistance systems. of The post-doctoral researcher would be expected to support the research activities of the BacTrans project including execution of individual project goals and guidance of PhD students and a research assistant to ensure the timely execution of the project goals, while also contributing the communication of the research findings emanating from the research.. . Qualifications And Experience Required. . Candidates for the postdoctoral position should have a PhD in Molecular Microbiology, Genetics, Biochemistry, Bioinformatics or related fields. The expertise and relevant experience of candidates should be supported by evidence of peer-reviewed publications in reputable scientific journals.. . Post Duration: 18 months. . Salary: €38,630 - €45,942 p.a. (IUA Salary Scale). . Project Title: BacTrans: Natural DNA transfer systems for bacterial starter cultures. . For an information package including further details of the post see . Job ID: 044371.. . 12 months, Fixed-term, Whole-time Post. . Position Summary. . The Marine Geosciences Research Group, School of Biological, Earth & Environmental Science, University College Cork, are seeking a motivated Post-Doctoral Researcher to join the I-MORE project. The successful candidate will be based at UCC in the Marine Geosciences Research Group and will work closely with industry partners (Gavin & Doherty Geosolutions) as well as academics and researchers in partner institutions (SFI Centre for Research in Applied Geosciences (iCRAG) and the SFI Research Centre for Energy, Climate and Marine (MaREI)).. . Offshore wind energy is rapidly coming of age, with European offshore wind output at the end of 2020 at approximately 25 GW. In parallel with the increased volume of offshore energy, there has been a dramatic reduction in the Levelised Cost of Energy (LCOE) for recent European projects. However, despite offshore wind gaining global traction and Ireland being one of the earliest movers of this technology when the Arklow Bank Phase 1 wind farm was commissioned in 2004, Ireland are now significantly behind the curve with respect to global offshore wind markets.. . The I-MORE project is a multi-disciplinary project involving industry, academic and state partners that will act as a pilot study to demonstrate the potential for early stage national survey campaigns to provide baseline data to inform marine spatial planning and optimised offshore wind developments. The project will focus on gathering early stage site information with respect to geological, geophysical, geotechnical and metocean conditions to allow a holistic view of an offshore zone/site to be determined. The project will initially target a number of key sites for site investigation using advanced geotechnical methods. Initially, existing geophysical and geological datasets (e.g. INFOMAR) will be analysed, interpreted, and developed into a set of ground models to inform shallow ground conditions and assist with site identification. Following site data collection, the geotechnical data will be integrated with the legacy geophysical data to develop a new geotechno-stratigraphic framework and classification for Irish specific seabed conditions. This map output can be used to inform the potential for offshore wind energy through a combined suitability, constraint and hazard analysis with regard to marine spatial planning.. . Scope. . Post-Doctoral Researcher will drive Work Package 2 of I-MORE: Pilot Site Identification.. . The aim of this WP is to conduct a desktop study to identify potential sites for surveying during WP3 by establishing a national constraint map pertinent to the overall objects of the I-MORE project (i.e. select sites and characterise); produce a stakeholder engagement roadmap; hold a stakeholder workshop; and produce optimal site listing and characterisation report. By the end of this WP, the I-MORE project will have identified the preferred, optimal sites to survey for the next phase of the project; characterised thee sites by an initial ground model using available geological and geophysical data; and identified and engaged with all major stakeholders on the project.. . Project Title: Informing and Mapping the Offshore Renewable Environment (I-MORE). . Post Duration: 12 Months. . Salary:€38,630 - €45,942 p.a. (IUA Salary Scale). . For an information package including further details of the post see Job ID: 044491.. . Informal enquiries can be made in confidence to Professor Andy Wheeler, School of Biological, Earth and Environmental Sciences, Email: click apply .. . Additional comments. . Applications must be submitted online via the University College Cork vacancy portal ( Queries relating to the online application process should be referred to click apply , quoting the job-title and project name.. . Candidates should apply, in confidence, before 12 noon (Irish Local Time) on Monday, 26 April 2021. No late applications will be accepted.. . 1 Year, Fixed-term, Whole-time Post. . Position Summary. . Applications are invited for a postdoctoral research position investigating the taphonomy of melanin. The position is funded by the European Research Council and forms part of a series of new hires in palaeontology at UCC.. . The project. . The successful candidate will undertake analysis of extant and fossil amphibians, mammals, birds and reptiles plus taphonomic experiments using in-house facilities for laboratory decay and high pressure-high temperature maturation. Key analytical techniques include synchrotron-XRF, FTIR, Raman spectroscopy, AHPO-LCMS, NMR, S-XANES. In addition to research, the successful candidate will have opportunities to undertake postdoctoral training in transferable skills and to participate in fieldwork. There may be opportunities to gain Mentorship or Teaching/Supervision experience under the supervision of the PI.. . The successful candidate will work closely with the PI and other members of the team, especially a PhD student also working on the taphonomy of melanin.. . The School of Biological, Earth and Environmental Sciences (BEES). . The School of BEES at University College Cork (UCC) is one of the most successful Schools in UCC in terms of grant capture and PhD completion, and has the distinction of having four ERC-funded projects in the last five years. It is located in three interconnected buildings on extensive grounds and comprises 30 academic staff, 20 postdoctoral researchers and >100 postgraduate students supported by 14 administrative and technical staff. The successful candidate will benefit from excellent laboratory facilities, including a dedicated palaeontology laboratory with high-spec facilities for experimental decay and maturation, melanin extraction, and tissue preparation for electron microscopy. The School’s new Mary Ward microbeam laboratory houses a new JEOL IT-100 VP SEM with sputter coater, a Perkin-Elmer Frontier uATR coupled to a Spotlight micro-FTIR, a Renishaw Raman microscope, extensive light microscopy facilities, and an ultramicrotome. Planned analytical facilities include a major new investment in a hyphenated TGA-FTIR-GC-MS facility for chemical analyses of maturation experiments in real time. Additional laboratory facilities include a furnace, dedicated histology lab, and photography facilities. Researchers in the palaeobiology group have access to additional analytical facilities elsewhere in the university, including cryotomy and immunofluorescence imaging.. . The successful candidate will join us at a very exciting time, as part of a major expansion of the palaeontology group at UCC. This includes new PhD and post-doctoral researchers, research support officer, outreach officer, and a new lecturer in palaeontology. The successful candidate will benefit from the PI’s commitment in his/her career development and her extensive global network of collaborators.. . Position start date: between 1/9/2021 and 1/1/2022 (negotiable).. . Project Title: Palaeochem: Biomolecular innovation and the evolution of animals – insights from taphonomy and the fossil record. Subproject: The taphonomy of melanin. . Post Duration: 1 year, with potential two-year extension. . Salary: €38,630 - €45,942 p.a. (IUA Salary Scale). . For an information package including further details of the post see . Job ID: 044551.. . Informal enquiries can be made in confidence to Professor Maria McNamara, Professor of Palaeontology, School of Biological, Earth and Environmental Sciences, , Email: click apply .. . Additional comments. . Applications must be submitted online via the University College Cork vacancy portal ( and should include a CV (including contact details of two referees) and cover letter. Queries relating to the online application process should be referred to click apply , quoting the job-title and project name.. . Candidates should apply, in confidence, before 12 noon (Irish Local Time) on Friday, 23 April 2021. No late applications will be accepted.. . Description. . Lead Data Engineer. . There has never been a better time to join Extreme, after three acquisitions extending our portfolio and go to market strategy, we have seen enormous opportunity and growth within the regions. Aside from being a Technology Leader in the Gartner Magic Quadrant, we also adamantly promote an internal culture that truly embraces diversity, inclusion and equality in the workplace. Having Diversity and Inclusion as part of our core values and beliefs, we’re proud to foster an environment where every Extreme employee can thrive because of their differences, not despite them. Our moto here at Extreme is ‘Advance with us’ and it applies to everyone we work with – inside and outside the company.. . Job Description. . We are looking for a Lead Data Engineer to join our cross functional global team, who are on a mission to create the best data driven Cloud based network management system that utilizes machine learning and AI to help our customers manage their networks more effectively and reduce risk of network issues by proactively detecting and resolving them. To complete the first phase, you will work within the team to operationalize the various analytical and ML anomaly detection models for production.. . To achieve this operationalization, you will need to work closely with the Cloud Operations and Application teams to integrate our industry leading ExtremeCloud IQ Network Management SAAS cloud-based application.. . Design, build and manage data infrastructure.. Experience with task orchestration and data workflows.. Experience of big data technologies such as Hive, Presto, Spark. Design and develop enterprise grade pipelines to operate cloud agnostically.. Needs to be a strong communicator and relationship builder to work closely with the various internal teams to integrate solutions into the current product production environment.. Improve our data engineering capabilities and capacity by keeping constantly aware of rapidly evolving data engineering best practices.. . . Desired. . Minimum 5+ years’ experience in similar role. Must have operationalized big data analytical & ML solutions in production.. Bachelor’s degree in Computer Science or equivalent technical domain.. AWS, Azure or GCP certifications related to data management and engineering preferred.. Can demonstrate having built and maintained excellent working relationships with co-workers and interfacing teams in a previous role.. Experience with MLOps tooling and techniques, in particular Kubeflow, a bonus.. . . Extreme Networks, Inc. (EXTR) creates effortless networking experiences that enable all of us to advance. We push the boundaries of technology leveraging the powers of machine learning, artificial intelligence, analytics, and automation. Over 50,000 customers globally trust our end-to-end, cloud-driven networking solutions and rely on our top-rated services and support to accelerate their digital transformation efforts and deliver progress like never before. For more information, visit Extreme's website or follow us on Twitter, LinkedIn, and Facebook.. . We encourage people from underrepresented groups to apply. Come Advance with us! In keeping with our values, no employee or applicant will face discrimination/harassment based on: race, color, ancestry, national origin, religion, age, gender, marital domestic partner status, sexual orientation, gender identity, disability status, or veteran status. Above and beyond discrimination/harassment based on “protected categories,” Extreme Networks also strives to prevent other, subtler forms of inappropriate behavior (e.g., stereotyping) from ever gaining a foothold in our organization. Whether blatant or hidden, barriers to success have no place at Extreme Networks.. Show more

Research Scientist, Dublin, Ireland. . This is an outstanding opportunity to play a key role on the Computational Creativity team at Accenture Labs in Dublin, Ireland - part of a network of over 200 Applied R&D specialists at seven locations worldwide. We incubate and prototype new insights and concepts that are encouraged to have a significant strategic near-term impact on our clients’ businesses. . The Dublin Labs team focuses on Artificial Intelligence technologies and our passion is imagining and demonstrating the possibilities created & built by ground-breaking AI tech.. . The ideal candidate will be a specialist in one or more areas of AI with experience in Deep Learning and Generative Networks (GANs, VAEs etc.). Your professional, collaborative approach, validated by your research outputs coupled with your imaginative and engaging communication style, will see you contributing in a fast-paced, highly collaborative and influential team in Accenture's Global R&D CoE!. . REQUIRED SKILLSET:. . . . Expertise in at least one area of AI. . . . Expertise in Deep Learning & Generative Networks (e.g., GANs). . . . Proven integrity, as evidenced by your research outputs. . . . Demonstrated ability to prototype and test your concepts. . . . Expertise in Data Analysis and Machine Learning. . . . Strong development skills (e.g., Python, Java etc.). . . . QUALIFICATIONS & EXPERIENCE:. . . . PhD in computer science, engineering or a related scientific field. . . . 2+ years' experience within AI and deep learning environments. . . . Experience of generative networks and their application in or more of the following areas: data synthesis, data privacy and data imputation.. . . . A record of publications in relevant conferences and journals. . . . Experience of prototyping and testing your concepts. . . . Exposure to Health and Life Sciences related projects, a distinct advantage. . . Does this appeal to you? If so, we wish to hear from you.. . Please advise if you have any particular requirements, so we can look into arranging reasonable adjustments to the recruitment process. You can contact us at accessIErecruitment@accenture.com. . Accenture is a global professional services company with leading capabilities in digital, cloud and security. Combining unmatched experience and specialized skills across more than 40 industries, we offer Strategy and Consulting, Interactive, Technology and Operations services—all powered by the world’s largest network of Advanced Technology and Intelligent Operations centers. Our 514,000 people deliver on the promise of technology and human ingenuity every day, serving clients in more than 120 countries. We embrace the power of change to create value and shared success for our clients, people, shareholders, partners and communities. Visit us at www.accenture.com.. . . Show more

Data Architect. . Role Overview. . Responsible for evaluating the current state of the company’s databases and data systems.. Analyse , identify new solutions to increase efficiency, performance and data insights .. Designs database solutions to ensure company information is stored effectively and securely. Defines the overall data structure, including recovery, security, integration, backup, and capability specifications.. Responsible for design and maintenance of Enterprise Data Model.. Developing database solutions to store and retrieve company information data strategy. Analysing structural requirements for new software and applications.. Works closely with data engineers in designing and building company data.. We are looking for a Data Architect to build, optimize and maintain conceptual and logical database models. Creates database solutions, evaluates requirements, documents systems, designs integrations and data consumption layers including interfaces and reports.. . Primary Objectives. . Design and Maintenance of Enterprise data model. Analyses system requirements. Architectural designs of integration and migration methods for data. Develop database solutions to store and retrieve company information. Optimize new and current data systems. Design and implement effective database solutions and models to store and retrieve company data. Examine and identify database structural necessities by evaluating client operations, applications, and programming. Prepare accurate database design and architecture reports for management and executive teams. Recommend solutions to improve new and existing database systems. Educate staff members through training and individual support. Work as bridge between BA and developers translating BA requirements into technical solutions. Analysing and documenting business processes, system architecture and business/functional requirements. Creating standards, structures and data governance. Designing integration architecture including: data flow, process flow and ETL integrations. Documentation and design of data consumption layer including definition of reports, interfaces and Rest API architecture. Defining and supervising implementation of Enterprise Data Standards and good practices. Redesign the Integration, Rest API layer, Web services, Data flows between applications. . Knowledge & Skills. . Proven 5 years work experience as a Data Architect, Data Scientist, Data/System Analyst or similar role. In-depth understanding of database structure principles. Experience gathering and analysing system requirements. Knowledge of data mining and segmentation techniques. Expertise in SQL and Oracle. Knowledge of DB tuning. Proven analytical skills. Familiarity with data visualization tools. Problem-solving attitude. Strong knowledge of database structure systems and data mining. Excellent organizational and analytical abilities.. Outstanding problem solver. Good written and verbal communication skills.. Experience in working across multiple business processes, systems and platforms. Experience with business process mapping/documentation, developing use cases, documenting system architecture and creating concept and context diagrams. Strong process documentation skills. Hands-on experience with Enterprise Architect or similar tool for UML modelling. Fluent English is a must. Nice to have knowledge of big data tools i.e Kafka, Spark, Mongo DB. Experience in designing Enterprise Solutions. . Show more

Data Engineer. .  . . Why We Work at Dun & Bradstreet. . We are at a transformational moment in our company journey - and we’re so excited about it. Each day, we are finding new ways to strengthen our award-winning culture, and to accelerate creativity, innovation and growth. Our purpose is to help customers improve business performance with Dun & Bradstreet’s Data Cloud and Live Business Identity, and we’re wildly passionate and committed to this purpose. So, if you’re looking to make an immediate impact at a company that welcomes bold and diverse thinking, come join us!. .  . . The Role: As a Data Engineer, you will be working as part of an agile scrum team as an analyst on a new, cutting edge cloud native platform designed to accumulate, derive meaning from, and apply stewardship to, large, diverse datasets. The role will share KPIs and collaborate closely with internal Data Owner teams, Technology Cloud Ops and SRE teams as well as engage directly with external source data providers and partners.. .  . . Key Responsibilities:. . Develop logical business rules instructing how to process, validate, transform and derive data using D&B protocols and standards. Manage the implementation of the rules into production environments, adhering to required data management and governance practices. Perform data analysis using a variety of database query and visualization tools to identify and understand issues or events. Provide technical expertise in extracting, integrating, and analyzing critical data. Enable decision-making by retrieving and aggregating data from multiple sources to present it in a digestible and actionable format. Write test case scenarios, prepare test data and perform User Acceptance testing. Create documentation, reports and dashboards to support the effective management and operation of the platform. .  . . Key Requirements:. . 3 - 5 years of experience within a similar role. Experience working as a member of one or more agile teams and SCRUM methodology. Robust data knowledge preferably around business data sets with proven analytical and quantitative skills and an ability to use data and metrics to back up assumptions, develop business cases, and complete root cause analyses. Strong Data Modelling & Mapping knowledge along with experience in XML & JSON document formats. Knowledge of ETL & Data Processing using Cloud Based Technologies (AWS Preferred). Strong communication skills with the ability to collaborate and build cross team relations. Proven ability to drive results and to implement complex, technical, multi-organizational programs. Passionate and curious about data with the ability to query and analyze datasets in order to drive fact- based decisions. A Degree in Data Science, Information Systems, Computer Science, Business, Economics, Mathematics or similar. . . . . All employees and contractors working in D&B should be aware that they have responsibilities in relation to the Company’s Business Management System. This relates to information and its security, quality, environment and health and safety both during and post-employment with D&B.. . . . . Job Description. . 20 years of untapped data waiting to be explored! The digital revolution is changing everything, especially in pharmaceuticals, and Novartis has embraced a bold strategy to drive a company-wide digital transformation. With this mission, we have setup a Data as a Service (DaaS) team at Novartis Hyderabad, which is working with the Chief Digital Office (CDO), Novartis Business units and industry leading technology partners, to drive the execution of Novartis’ data strategy, turning its rich data resources into real strategic assets to drive actionable insights across the organization. This ambition is one of key pillars in the broader digital transformation happening at Novartis to be a ‘medicines and data science company.. . Your responsibilities:. Your responsibilities include, but are not limited to:. . Bring deep domain understanding in at least one of the following areas – a) Pharma R&D, b) Manufacturing, Procurement and Supply Chain and c) Marketing and Sales.. Drive implementation of enterprise wide data strategy by applying the enterprise data services through an aligned operating model with CDO (Chief Digital Office) and IT and enable execution of specific business use cases. Define and shape specific data/ analytics use cases by working closely with stakeholders in Novartis business domains. Build trusted partnership with the stakeholders and champion the value of clean and linked data. Provide technical leadership in data management to the team and be able to roll up sleeves to perform hands on technical work as needed. Can act as a hands-on engineer in curating data, onboarding data assets to the FAIRification process and managing data quality and standards.. Manage quality and consistency of NBS CONEXTS data services delivery to all stakeholders. Ensure compliance with GMP and regulatory requirements and continuous improvement of quality relevant processes within area of responsibility. Adopt AGILE ways of working and manage quality and consistency of data services delivery to all stakeholders.. . . . Minimum Requirements. . What you’ll bring to the role:. . Ability to drive large scale execution of enterprise wide data strategy by applying the standardized Data Management approach aligned to FAIR data principles. Ability to act as technical specialist in data engineering & management. Ability to bring strong domain understanding and pharma knowledge to ensure high quality data services. Ability to promote cultural change towards building a more data-centered organization. Ability to work in cross cultural teams, provide servant leadership to AGILE teams at the global level, engage with senior stakeholders and drive decision making. . . . Desirable requirements:. . Experience with Semantic Web and Ontology standards. Masters/ PhD in Computer sciences/ IT or other quantitative sciences. 7+ years of experience in global company as data steward, engineer, modeler, data scientist. Understanding of data modeling (conceptual, logical and physical), understanding of semantic modelling and graph databases.. Experience on data wrangling including Ingestion, Unification, Anonymization, Search, Master & Meta Data Management and Governance. Experience in working with ETL process and programming skill for data preparation and analysis. Foundational understanding of big data ecosystem, knowledge of AWS, Azure stack, NLP would be an advantage.. Business understanding of pharmaceutical industry and data standards. Proven track record in at least one of the following areas – a) Pharma R&D, b) Manufacturing, Procurement and Supply Chain and c) Marketing and Sales. Experience in working in Pharma / Life Science industry strongly preferred. . . . You’ll receive:. Competitive salary, Annual bonus, Pension scheme, Share scheme, Health insurance, 25 days annual leave, Flexible working arrangements, subsidized dining facilities, Employee recognition scheme, learning and development opportunities.. . *Please note this role is based in Dublin, Ireland and requires the person to be based in Ireland.*. . . . . *Extensive experience running focus groups and commercial market research experience are absolutely essential for this role. Any applications without this criteria will not be considered.*. . . . . . . . About Bricolage. . Bricolage is a research and strategy consultancy. We specialise in client briefs that require a deeper understanding of human experience - be that of brands, products, services or cultures. Making sense of these experiences helps to inspire solutions that win for our clients. We are rapidly growing with a mission to build a world class global consultancy based in Dublin but looking beyond Irish shores in terms of impact.. . . . . About the role. . . . . We are looking for a smart, savvy researcher to join our research team to help us produce better brands, products, experiences, communications and decisions. Your brief will be wide-ranging and your insights will influence clients when they are embarking on interesting but difficult challenges. Our insight work informs the brief that unlocks the problem.. . Qualitative research plays a huge role in everything we do. You will support the research function and the research roadmap, maintaining an ongoing stream of research work. Reporting to our Director of Research, you will run research projects from start to finish, producing clear insights, conclusions and recommendations.. . . . . Responsibilities will include:. . Working with new product development and marketing clients to identify and prioritise research initiatives.. Conducting end-to-end qualitative research studies; planning, recruitment, execution, analysis and delivery.. Bringing rigour and validity to our research, while also having a flexible and open-minded approach.. Deploying a wide variety of research techniques (primarily qualitative) and applying them in different contexts: at the beginning, middle and end of projects; for tactical and strategic purposes.. Researching with purpose. Always being clear as to why we are conducting research.. Communicating insights that are meaningful and actionable, with utmost clarity. An ability to develop strong relationships across the business.. A willingness to dig deep into our business and the lives of our participants.. Helping more junior members of the team to grow in their skills.. . . . . About you: (the essentials). . . . . 5+ years working as a Qualitative or UX researcher in a professional / commercial (non-academic) environment.. A track record of running qualitative research studies that have delivered real impact on a product or service.. Working knowledge of diverse qualitative, ethnographic and netnographic research techniques.. Experience planning and executing international research.. Excellent collaboration skills - you enjoy working with others and are happy being part of a cross-functional team.. Capable of working in a lean and informal way to uncover insights quickly. . Fascinated by people, their behaviours and motivations.. A portfolio demonstrating previous research projects will be required as part of your application.. Presenting your findings and helping clients find solutions is exciting for you.. You have a drive to succeed and want to be part of a culture aiming for the highest standards in its field.. . . . . We’re nice to work for: . . . . . Competitive salary.. Target-driven bonuses.. Healthy work-life balance.. Covid did not invent opportunities to work from home.. Generous holidays.. A friendly, collaborative working environment.. Exciting project work that has real impact.. An innovative research culture: insight is a creative endeavour.. Learning and growth culture is heavily invested in.. Active ‘craic and culture’ calendar of events.. . . . . Please apply with CV and cover letter to mary@bricolage.ie. . Show more

Job Description. . Zendesk is a service-first CRM company that builds powerful, customizable software crafted to improve customer relations. At Zendesk, we encourage growth, innovation and believe in giving back to the communities we call home.. . Our Enterprise Data & Analytics (EDA) is looking for a talented and experienced Staff Data Engineer to join our growing platform & engineering team. You’ll work in a collaborative Agile environment using the latest in engineering best practices with involvement in all aspects of the software development lifecycle. You will be responsible for ensuring the team makes sound design & configuration decisions to develop curated data products, applies standard architectural practices, and supports the Data Product Managers in evolving core data products. You will primarily develop on Google Cloud Platform and other technologies such as Linux, Docker, Kubernetes, BigQuery, Kafka, Airflow, and Python.. . What You Bring To The Role. . Drive data architecture and integration design and development discussions with engineering and other teams. Programming and automation of Data processing systems in Linux/Cloud environment. Ability to quickly master new technologies. 7+ years of software development or DevOps/DataOps experience. Ability to work effectively in a dynamic, occasionally interrupt-driven environment that includes geographically spread teams and customers. Experience in developing and operating high-volume, high-availability environments. Previous experience with Linux, Docker and Kubernetes. Previous experience with AWS or GCP. Good command of Python or Go.. BA/BS degree in Engineering, CS, or equivalent. . . What You Get To Do Every Single Day. . Solve complex problems and provide sustainable solutions. Help to build and operate internal analytical platform. Identify, design, and implement internal process improvements: automating manual processes, optimising data delivery, re-designing infrastructure for greater scalability, etc.. Build the infrastructure required for optimal extraction, transformation, and loading of data from a wide variety of data sources. Work in an agile development environment. Participate in an on-call rotation along with the rest of the team. Use a wide variety of technologies, learn new things, wear lots of hats (actual hats optional). Participate in diverse projects and collaborate with engineering, product, analytics teams. Have fun and enjoy your time @ Zendesk. . . What The Stack Looks Like. . Our platform runs on GCP and AWS, fully orchestrated by Kubernetes. We use Terraform and helm to deploy and manage platform components.. Our data pipeline is built on Kafka, EMR, GCS, BigQuery and Airflow. And the underlying code written in Python and Go. . . Zendesk builds software for better customer relationships. It empowers organizations to improve customer engagement and better understand their customers. Zendesk products are easy to use and implement. They give organizations the flexibility to move quickly, focus on innovation, and scale with their growth.. . More than 150,000 paid customer accounts in over 150 countries and territories use Zendesk products. Based in San Francisco, Zendesk has operations in the United States, Europe, Asia, Australia, and South America.. . Interested in knowing what we do in the community? Check out the Zendesk Neighbor Foundation to learn more about how we engage with, and provide support to, our local communities.. . Zendesk is an equal opportunity employer, and we’re proud of our ongoing efforts to foster global diversity, equity, & inclusion in the workplace. Individuals seeking employment at Zendesk are considered without regard to race, color, religion, national origin, age, sex, gender, gender identity, gender expression, sexual orientation, marital status, medical condition, ancestry, physical or mental disability, military or veteran status, or any other characteristic protected by applicable law.. . By submitting your application, you agree that Zendesk may collect your personal data for recruiting, global organization planning, and related purposes. Zendesk's Candidate Privacy Notice explains what personal information Zendesk may process, where Zendesk may process your personal information, its purposes for processing your personal information, and the rights you can exercise over Zendesk’s use of your personal information.. The role Data Scientist. . We are looking for a Data Scientist to join our dynamic team based in our Dublin office.. . Why we need you -. . Working within a team of Data Scientists and Machine Learning Engineers, you will develop and operationalise cutting-edge machine learning models.. . You will work closely with many different teams across the business, using machine learning and advanced analytics to contribute to their success and help translate business vision into actionable technical outcomes.. . You will have the opportunity to work on interesting and varied projects, including deep learning, recommendation systems, real-time CRM, and NLP.. . Who Are We Looking For -. . You will have experience working as a Data Scientist with a degree or MSc/PhD in a STEM subject.. A passion for data science and experience delivering machine learning or analytics projects in an academic or corporate environment.. You’ll have understanding of statistical methods and machine learning techniques.. You will be proficient in at least one programming language (Python, R, Scala).. Experience manipulating large datasets using SQL, Spark, or similar.. The ability to tell a story through data and explain technical concepts to stakeholders.. . As the ideal candidate, you will have -. . Previous experience in the online gaming industry.. Proficiency with the PyData stack and experience with deep learning frameworks.. Hands on experience working with big data solutions and/or cloud technology.. Knowledge of git and version control as well as experience working with Unix/Linux environments.. Knowledge of computer science concepts such as memory management, time complexity and parallelisation would be a plus.. . What’s in it for you?. . Our experience-based salaries are competitive. Plus, there’s a discretionary annual performance bonus. And we provide advice and dedicated assistance to those moving to Dublin.. . Your package will include. . health and dental insurance for you, your partner and your children (if you all live at the same address). a personal interest allowance to let you learn something new or pursue a hobby. the option to join our company pension scheme. 1000 EUR as congratulations if you have a baby whilst you work for us. in-house training and development to develop your skills, progressing your career. free fresh fruit, snacks and drinks in the office. access to an onsite gym and subsidised canteen.. . What happens next?. . If you’re what we’re looking for, next up will be a phone interview. And if that goes well, we’ll meet you for a Zoom/face-to-face interview.. . The Group. . PokerStars is part of Flutter Entertainment Plc, a global sports betting, gaming and entertainment provider headquartered in Dublin and part of the FTSE 100 index of the London Stock Exchange. Flutter brings together exceptional brands, products and businesses and a diverse global presence in a safe, responsible and ultimately sustainable way.. . We are an equal opportunity employer that values diversity. We do not discriminate on any protected characteristic as defined by applicable law.. . We will look to provide reasonable accommodation for applicants with disabilities to participate in the job application or interview process. If you need assistance, please contact talent@starsgroup.com. . Please note we cannot accept general applications; this inbox is just for providing support to those who need it.. Show more

Date Posted. . 2021-03-29-07:00. . Country. . Ireland. . Location. . LOC9008: United Technologies Research Center Ireland , 4th Floor, Penrose Business Center, Penrose Wharf, Cork - Ireland. . Primary Job Responsibilities. . Research, design and prototype analytics algorithms utilizing data from multiple sources and sensors. Define scientific and technical problems, develop solutions and plan technical tasks. Work as part of a multidisciplinary, multinational research team fostering collaboration and teamwork. Initiate, propose and execute R&D activities, including technology development both internally and within external collaborative EU research projects. Partner with universities, government agencies, national labs, and professional organizations. Writing scientific reports, articles and patents. Keeping ahead with the latest developments and fostering new ideas and new problem definitions. . Basic Qualifications. . A proven research applied or academic track record on Machine Learning, Signal Processing and Statistics in one of the fields of numerical data analytics (diagnostics and prognostics), speech processing or image and video analysis. Experience in incubation and development of R&D proposals in novel areas (for example for EU or other government funding). Experience of working in collaborative projects and partnerships, and project management. A PhD in Computer Science, Electrical or Computer Engineering, Mathematics with a few years of industrial or academic experience, or a Master’s degree with significant experience of industry or academia. . Preferred Qualifications. . Experience on analytics on the edge or applications of data analytics for embedded systems. Strong knowledge of methods in at least one of the areas of deep learning, graph-based methods, Bayesian modelling and inference, statistical learning and state-of-the-art software tools (e.g. Python, C++, etc.). Communication skills and ability to provide timely, accurate reports and presentations to senior management and functional teams. Prior experience with applied industrial or aerospace research is desirable. Well organized interpersonal and communication skills. Prior experience of creating intellectual property and patents. . Raytheon Technologies is An Equal Opportunity/Affirmative Action Employer. All qualified applicants will receive consideration for employment without regard to race, color, religion, sex, sexual orientation, gender identity, national origin, disability or veteran status, age or any other federally protected class.. .
